channel.title: Raleigh NC Parks and Recreation News
channel.description: Latest news from Raleigh Parks and Recreation

item.title: March Madness Cornhole Classic (Feb 19, 2026)
item.description:
This casual doubles event is designed for players of all skill levels, focusing on friendly competition, music, food, and community connection. Teams will play multiple guaranteed games before advancing to a short playoff round, keeping the event engaging and social from start to finish. 

Whether you’re playing, cheering, or just enjoying the atmosphere, this is a great way to kick off March Madness in the park.



Prizes for the top three and the best team name!
One registration per team - Please register your teammate and team name.



Location: Latta University Historic Park
Date: Sunday, March 15
Time: 2 - 6 p.m.
Ages: All
Cost: $10 per team
Register on RecLink

item.title: Raleigh Parks from Bond to Beyond (Feb 19, 2026)
item.description:
Join Raleigh Parks for a fun, family-friendly afternoon where you can learn about the progress on 23 Parks Bond projects across the city, meet the people behind the work, and see how a community’s vote becomes parks that serve us all.  



Enjoy food, music, games, arts activities, and a chance to win prizes in our event raffle!



Learn what’s happening now, and what’s coming next



Location: Dix Park, Greg Poole, Jr., All Faiths Chapel
Date: Thursday, March 26
Time: 4:30 - 7:30 p.m.
Ages: Family-friendly event
Cost: Free

item.title: Gather and Grow with Us at Our Urban Farm Open House (Feb 11, 2026)
item.description:
Operated and supported in partnership with Raleigh City Farm, our Urban Farm was created in 2025 as a way to grow and distribute fresh produce to members of the Raleigh community. 

Take a tour, enjoy some fresh produce, chat with the farmers, learn about volunteer opportunities, and meet your neighbors at this drop-in opportunity to see all things going on with our Urban Farm! 

The welcoming ceremony to officially establish our partnership will be held at 6 p.m. Check in at the lobby of Marsh Creek Community Center when you arrive to start your tour experience. This is a rain-or-shine event.

Location: Marsh Creek Community Center
Date: Thursday, March 19
Time: 2 - 7:30 p.m., Welcoming Ceremony at 6 p.m.
Ages: All
Cost: Free

item.title: Adventure Awaits: Private Outdoor Group Programs (Feb 11, 2026)
item.description:
Private outdoor adventure programs open in May, offering customizable, hands-on experiences for all ages, from families and scouts to adult and professional groups.



Perfect for birthdays, homeschool days, badge work, or team-building, each program fosters discovery, confidence, and connection. Led by experienced instructors, experiences are flexible, scalable, and can be added to facility rentals. Group discounts (10+) may apply.

item.title: Summer Reservations at the Lake (Feb 10, 2026)
item.description:
Using our reservations portal is the quickest and most sure way to guarantee that you get the shelter you want for your plans out at the Lake!



Location: Lake Wheeler
Shelter Rental Cost: $12 - $30 per hour
Request a Shelter on RecLink

item.title: Historic Raleigh Trolley Tours (Feb 26, 2026)
item.description:
Hop aboard the trolley to tour downtown Raleigh and learn about the city's rich history. Tours are an hour long and leave from Mordecai Historic Park. 



Dates: Saturdays, March - December
Times: 11 a.m., 12 p.m., 1 p.m., and 2 p.m.
Cost: $10 for adults, $6 for seniors and youth (7-17)
Free for children 6 and under
Ages: All ages
Get Tickets on RecLink

item.title: Resin Wine Glass Making is Back! (Feb 26, 2026)
item.description:
Biltmore Hills Community Center



News Published 2/26/2026 Updated 2/26/2026



In this program, you will create different media art projects that you can take home while socializing with your fellow community members. All materials will be provided unless the instructor specifies pre-purchased items.



Location: Biltmore Hills Community Center
Date: Wednesdays, March 4 and  11
Time: Noon - 2 p.m.
Ages: All
Cost: $20 
Register on RecLink



Biltmore Hills Park

item.title: A New Nash: Kick-Off Party & Open House (Feb 18, 2026)
item.description:
Historic Nash Square is one of our Capital City’s original public open spaces!



Join us as we kick off the Nash Square Public Realm Plan to learn about its past and present, and to help shape its future. Raleigh Parks is excited to create a New Nash that reflects the unique needs and desires of the community. We welcome your input and look forward to collaborating with you!



This event is family-friendly and will include activities for people of all ages. Accommodations and translation services are available upon request. Please contact nashsquare@publicinput.com for requests and assistance.  



Learn more & participate in the planning process!



Location: Whiskey Kitchen (201 W. Martin Street, Raleigh, NC 27601)
Date: Thursday, Feb. 26 
Time: 5:30 - 8 p.m.
Ages: All
Cost: Free

item.title: 2026 Summer Concert Series (Feb 18, 2026)
item.description:
Each summer, local artists donate their talent and time to put on a great free show for the community. On select Sundays from now until Aug. 16, we will host groups performing a variety of different genres that will help set the tone for an awesome evening at these two beautiful facilities. 



May 31 - SWAG
June 7 - Blue Notes Jazz Band
July 12 - Invitation
July 19 - Thelonius
July 26 - Capital
Aug. 2 - The Holly Springs Community Band
Aug. 9 - Triangle Sax Ensemble
Aug. 23 - Carpe Diem Saxophone Quartet



June 21 - Eat a Peach
June 28 - Triangle Taiko
Aug. 16  - Bull City Trio



Sunday Evenings
Time: 6 - 8 p.m.
Ages: All
Cost: Free

item.title: Little Leprechaun (Feb 18, 2026)
item.description:
Calling all the little leprechauns, one and all! We are going to have a sham-ROCK of a good time creating crafts and reading stories to celebrate this fun holiday! Hope to see you soon! Pre-Registration is required.



Location: Hill Street Park
Date: Monday, March 16
Time: 3:30 - 4:30 p.m.
Ages: 2-5
Cost: $8 per participant
Register on RecLink

item.title: True Crime Trivia (Feb 9, 2026)
item.description:
Challenge your knowledge of real-life mysteries, puzzling cases, and surprising facts. Whether you are a seasoned detective or just love a good story, this night will be packed
with friendly competitions, fun laughs, and OH MY GOSH moments!



Location: Jaycee Community Center
Date: Tuesday, May 5
Time: 5:30 - 7:30 p.m.
Ages: 18 and older
Cost: $8
*You will, as one person, register for your team. Each team can have 3-5 members.
Registration coming soon!

item.title: Valentines Speed-Friending (Feb 9, 2026)
item.description:
Have you been looking for a gym partner? Maybe someone to share book recommendations with? 



This event will be a way to connect with other folks looking to make friendships! We will provide fun activities, treats, and conversation starters aimed at building community and starting new friendships.

Location: Five Points Center for Active Adults
Date: Thursday, Feb. 12
Time: 3 - 5 p.m.
Age: 18 and older
Cost: $5
Register on RecLink

item.title: Lucky Leprechauns and Grandparents (Feb 25, 2026)
item.description:
This special event is a perfect opportunity for grandparents and grandkids to come together and find the gold at the end of the rainbow. Come and join us at Kiwanis Park for a goodie hunt, tasty treat, fun family movie, and themed crafts!

Experience the richness of intergenerational bonds through engaging activities. Go green with us and stop at all of the stations to enjoy a fun-filled afternoon!

Participants 12 and under will be the registrants and must be accompanied by an adult.

Location: Kiwanis Community Center
Date: Monday, March 16
Time: 4 - 6 p.m.
Ages: All
Cost: Free
Register on RecLink

item.title: LGBTQIA+ Film Series (Feb 25, 2026)
item.description:
Join us for our monthly program on the first and fourth Tuesday of the month. We will be showcasing films with diverse themes around sexuality and gender. This program is co-hosted with the Carolina Aging Alliance.

Seating is limited, so please register in person or online. To register, visit reclink.raleighnc.gov and search keyword "LGBTQIA" or in person at any community center.



March's first film is "A Fantastic Woman (Una mujer fantastica)." Marina, a transgender woman who works as a waitress and moonlights as a nightclub singer, is bowled over by the death of her older boyfriend. Seating is limited, so please register in person or online. 



Date: Tuesday, March 3
Time: 2 - 4:15 p.m.
Age: 18 and older
Cost: Free
Register on RecLink



March's second film is "Flawless." An ultraconservative security guard suffers a debilitating stroke and is assigned to a rehabilitative program that includes singing lessons withe the drag queen next door. Seating is limited, so please register in person or online.



Date: Tuesday, March 24
Time: 2 - 4:15 p.m.
Age: 18 and older
Cost: Free
Register on RecLink



April's first film is "Vita & Virginia." The fascinating true story of the love affair between socialite and popular author Vita Sackville-West and literary icon Virginia Woolf. Seating is limited, so please register in person or online. 



Date: Tuesday, April 7
Time: 2 - 4:15 p.m.
Age: 18 and older
Cost: Free
Register on RecLink



April's second film is "Breaking Fast." Mo, a practicing Muslim living in West Hollywood, is learning to navigate life post-heartbreak. An All-American guy surprises Mo by offering to break fast with him during the holy month of Ramadan.



Date: Tuesday, April 28
Time: 2 - 4:15 p.m.
Age: 18 and older
Cost: Free
Register on RecLink

item.title: City of Raleigh Museum Animal Adoption Day (Feb 25, 2026)
item.description:
Come experience the love and connection that awaits—you might just find your perfect companion! This event is free and open to everyone, even if you just need some puppy love!

Location: City of Raleigh Museum
Date: Saturday, March 7
Time: 11 a.m. - 2 p.m.
Ages: All
Cost: Free
No registration is required

item.title: Away with the Fairies (Feb 17, 2026)
item.description:
Enter a market full of fairies, dragons, mischief, and more at this themed event. Set in Mordecai Historic Park's beautiful nature space, Paper & Stars Studio has gathered local makers, food vendors, and independent businesses to bring together the best of what Raleigh has to offer. 

Enjoy free crafts and activities, find the perfect handmade treasures, and celebrate Spring all while enjoying great food and fun. New this year, make your own fairy or dragon garden to take home! Don’t forget to wear your best fairy or fantasy attire!  



Location: Mordecai Historic Park
Date: Saturday, March 21
Time: 10 a.m. - 2 p.m.
Ages: All
Cost: Free



Please learn more and apply at Wonderstruck Festivals Vendor Application

item.title: Food Truck Fridays at John Chavis Memorial Park! (Feb 17, 2026)
item.description:
From May 1 through Aug. 28, join us every Friday from 6 - 9 p.m. as a rotating lineup of local food trucks serves up crowd favorites and new bites to try. 

Bring a blanket, gather your friends and family, and enjoy great food in the heart of the park all season long.



Date: Fridays starting May 1 - Aug. 28
Time: 6 - 9 p.m.
Ages: All
Cost: Free

item.title: Drop In and Celebrate National Tooth Fairy Day (Feb 16, 2026)
item.description:
Families are invited to drop by the community center to celebrate and discover simple, practical tips for strong dental habits, design their own personal tooth bags for future tooth fairy visits, and even head home with a free toothbrush.



Location: John Chavis Memorial Park
Date: Saturday, Feb. 28
Time: noon - 1 p.m.
Ages: All
Cost: Free

item.title: Tuesdays in the Square (Feb 24, 2026)
item.description:
A pop-up series to explore the Nash Square Public Realm Plan on the first and third Tuesdays of March and April.

Staff will be available from 11 a.m. - 1 p.m., with 15-minute tours focusing on the week's theme at 12 p.m. and 12:30 p.m. 

Everyone is welcome to share their experiences. See you at Nash Square!



Location: Nash Square
Time: 11 a.m. - 1 p.m., tours at 12 p.m. and 12:30 p.m. 
Ages: All
Cost: Free
No registration is required

item.title: Travel With Us: New Active Adult Day Trips Announced (Feb 23, 2026)
item.description:
Step into the 40,000-square-foot Billy Graham Library and explore the extraordinary life and legacy of one of the most influential public figures of the 20th century. This unforgettable visit takes you on a journey from Billy Graham’s humble farm beginnings to his role on the world stage as an advisor to presidents, a global traveler, and a voice heard by millions.



Nestled on 20 beautifully landscaped acres in Charlotte, North Carolina, just miles from his childhood home, the barn-shaped library offers a compelling blend of history, personal storytelling, and cultural impact. Journey at your leisure through immersive multimedia exhibits, photographs, and memorabilia, and you’ll gain insight into the life, times, and far-reaching influence of a man who helped shape modern American history.
- Charter motorcoach transportation
- Lunch on your own Dairy Barn
- General Admission Ticket



Time: 8:15 a.m. to 6 p.m.
Cost: $81/Residents $96/Non-residents
Additional Information
Trip Registration



Cedar Creek Gallery is a haven for art lovers year-round, but it truly comes alive during the Spring Pottery & Glass Festival. Watch nationally recognized artists transform raw materials into stunning works of art right before your eyes, and enjoy an up-close look at their techniques and creative processes through glass blowing, pottery, wood turning, and more.



In addition to incredible artist demonstrations, guests can wander through the beautiful gardens, purchase plants, and receive tips and advice from knowledgeable horticulturalists. Explore the gallery featuring the work of over 200 local and national artists and round out the day with live music and delicious offerings from food trucks.
- Lunch on your own at the food trucks



Time: 9:30 a.m. to 2 p.m.
Cost: $20/Residents $35/Non-residents
Additional Information
Trip Registration



Travel to Sanford, NC, Temple Theatre. Bright Star is a musical about a literary editor and a World War II soldier who discover a secret that changes their lives. The show is set in the American South in the 1920s and 1940s. When Alice Murphy meets a young soldier just home from World War II, he awakens her longing for the child she once lost. Haunted by their unique connection, Alice sets out on a journey to understand her past—and what she finds has the power to transform both of their lives.
- Lunch on your own downtown Sanford.

Time: 10:30 a.m. to 5 p.m.
Cost: $53/Residents $68/Non-residents
Additional Information
Trip Registration



Visit our website to learn more about our day and multi-day travel opportunities.

item.title: Raleigh Adult Athletics Registration (Feb 18, 2026)
item.description:
Raleigh Parks Athletics is offering adult softball, baseball, and kickball for ages 18 and up. Programs will be offered at various park locations throughout the city. Registration will be held from February 15-28. Interested athletes may register online or at any City of Raleigh community center. Adult leagues register as a team. Individuals who are interested in playing but are not currently part of a team need to contact the Athletics office to be placed on our Free Agent List.



For more information, please call 919-996-6836 or email Athletics@raleighnc.gov.



Registration Dates: Feb. 15-28
Cost: Varies
Ages: 18 and older
Register on RecLink

item.title: Do You Want to Become a Sports Official? (Feb 16, 2026)
item.description:
Are you a former athlete or a sports fanatic and want to get involved in the game? This sports officiating workshop will provide you with all the resources and information to get started in becoming an official. Learn what it takes to get connected in your local organization or association and make a difference in your community! Pre-registration is encouraged.



Location: Green Road Community Center
Date: Saturday, March 15
Time: 2 - 3:30 p.m.
Ages: 14 and older
Cost: Free
Register on RecLink

item.title: Raleigh Parks Expands Community Wellness Vision (Feb 16, 2026)
item.description:
Raleigh Parks, Recreation and Cultural Resources invites residents to help shape the future of Glen Eden Pilot Park through a series of community open houses this spring.



The Health & Wellness team is reimagining Glen Eden as a neighborhood wellness hub offering physical activity, nutrition education, mental well-being resources, environmental programming, and opportunities for social connection. Community input will directly guide future programs, partnerships, accessibility improvements, and long-term planning.



To register or learn more, visit Health & Wellness: Glen Eden Pilot Park



Each session will include interactive feedback stations, staff conversations, and light refreshments. Residents can share ideas on fitness classes, mental wellness programs, nutrition education, gardens and outdoor activities, youth programming, park amenities, and volunteer opportunities.



Open houses are free, ADA accessible, and open to all residents. Participants may drop in during event hours or complete an online survey .



Community feedback will inform next steps, with updates shared in summer 2026.

item.title: World Theatre Day at Lake Lynn (Feb 23, 2026)
item.description:
Enjoy various Theatres showcasing upcoming shows, interactive theatre games, tabling, and craft activities. Registration is encouraged.



There will also be two 35-minute improv sessions at 11:30 a.m. and 12:30 p.m. You’ll create spontaneous characters, play engaging games, and build confidence while learning the art of thinking on your feet. Perfect for all ages and experience levels! The Improv sessions are taught by Romni Rossi and have limited spaces.

Location: Lake Lynn Park
Date: Saturday, March 28
Time: 10 a.m. - 2 p.m.
Ages: All
Cost: Free
Register on RecLink

item.title: 2026 Raleigh Rockets Track Coaches (Feb 18, 2026)
item.description:
This program combines development, fundamentals, and technique with a focus on fun! Track experience is not required - we are looking for motivators. We want to inspire athletes to have a love for running and physical activity. This program will take place from March to June 2026. Two volunteers are needed at each location listed below at their respective times.



Ages: 18 and older



Mondays and Wednesdays, 5:30 - 7:30 p.m.
Brier Creek Park
Jaycee Park
Worthdale Park



Tuesdays and Thursdays, 5:30 - 7:30 p.m.
Abbotts Creek Park
Barwell Road Park
Biltmore Hills Park
Green Road Park
John Chavis Memorial Park
Method Community Park
Southgate Park

item.title: Life Crafts Camp (Feb 6, 2026)
item.description:
This half-day camp will teach hands-on life skills, including sewing, cooking, and gardening. These skills will support you through life! Participants should bring a snack and a water bottle. Advance registration is required.



Location: Peach Road Park
Date: Thursday, April 2
Time: 8 a.m. - noon
Ages: 7 - 11
Cost: $35 Residents / $50 Non-residents
Register on RecLink

item.title: Become a Raleigh Parks Marketing Ambassador! (Feb 6, 2026)
item.description:
They attend community events, engage with the attendees, and connect them with critical parks-related resources, like summer camp, financial assistance, and more!



Join our marketing ambassador team! This position offers a very flexible schedule. Events are posted, and ambassadors sign up based on availability and interest. Bilingual individuals are encouraged to apply.

item.title: Family Tree Yoga (Feb 5, 2026)
item.description:
We'll include age-appropriate poses to build confidence, partner poses to promote bonding, acroyoga to foster trust, and yoga games that make learning yoga fun! Reinforce your family's roots while creating a strong and grounded practice that will last for years to come. No experience necessary. Dress comfortably and bring a yoga mat.



Location: Hill Street
Date: Thursdays, March 3 - 26
Time: 4:30 - 5:30 p.m.
Ages: 3 - 5
Cost: $40
Register on RecLink

item.description:
Dates: Tuesday, June 16 - Sunday, June 21, 2026
Prices:

For trip questions and/or registration, contact Carmen Livingston at 919-996-4734 or carmen.livingston@raleighnc.gov 



Visit our website to learn more about our day and multi-day travel opportunities.

item.title: Low-Mow Spring (Feb 12, 2026)
item.description:
In our ongoing effort to support native wildflowers and provide vital pollinator habitat and early forage, we’re reducing spring mowing in many of our parks and preserves. With beneficial insect populations in decline, we take our role as stewards of Raleigh’s green spaces seriously. 

This initiative not only conserves resources but also supports local wildlife and enhances the beauty of our parks in a more sustainable way. By allowing select areas of our parks to grow more naturally, we’re creating vibrant, environmentally friendly spaces for everyone to enjoy.

Come mid-April, as the blooms begin to fade, we’ll resume our mowing routine. Until then, enjoy a peaceful Low-Mow Spring, Raleigh — complete with the calming sounds of nature and a break from the hum of power equipment!



To learn more about Raleigh's Pollinator Protection Projects, please visit our website.

item.title: Abbotts Creek Walking Group (Feb 12, 2026)
item.description:

item.description:

item.description:
Whether you are a seasoned crafter or just looking to try something new, this program is all about having fun, exploring your creative side, and meeting new people. We will provide the supplies for a different aft each month.

Location: Abbotts Creek Community Center

item.title: Celebrate Bike Month at Chavis with Oaks and Spokes (Feb 4, 2026)
item.description:
This fun-filled afterschool celebration brings together active movement, safe streets, Bike Month, and Bike & Roll to School Day. 

At the Kids Bike Rodeo, children will build confidence on two wheels while learning important bike safety skills. They’ll zoom through an obstacle course and explore a Traffic Garden, a child-sized streetscape where kids can practice road safety through hands-on play and imagination.



Location: John Chavis Memorial Park
Date: Wednesday, May 6
Time: 4 - 6 p.m.
Ages: All
Cost: Free
No Registration is Required
